title: Portugal's 'animal party' could be kingmaker with policy of lower taxes on pet food
text:
The demands of a radical Green animal rights party in Portugal for lower tax for pet food and vegetarian-only food at all state dinners may seem like eccentricities at best.

But when the votes are counted in a general elections on Sunday night, the policies may be closer to reality, with the new People-Animals-Nature (PAN) party tipped to become unlikely kingmakers.

Socialist leader António Costa is favourite to continue in power after successfully rolling back Brussels-imposed austerity as the country heads to the polls

But he may have to rely on support from the surging green start-ups threatening to break the Socialist's current coalition with the communists.

The increasing support for...
description: The demands of a radical Green animal rights party in Portugal for lower tax for pet food and vegetarian-only food at all state dinners may seem like eccentricities at best.
